00049 #define __CVMX_HELPER_BGX_H__

00061 #define CVMX_BGX_RX_FIFO_SIZE   (64 * 1024)
00062 #define CVMX_BGX_TX_FIFO_SIZE   (32 * 1024)
00063 
00064 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_enumerate(int xiface);
00065 
00066 /**
00067  * @INTERNAL
00068  * Disable the BGX port
00069  *
00070  * @param xipd_port IPD port of the BGX interface to disable
00071  */
00072 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_disable(int xipd_port);
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * @INTERNAL
00076  * Probe a SGMII interface and determine the number of ports
00077  * connected to it. The SGMII/XAUI interface should still be down after
00078  * this call. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.
00079  *
00080  * @param xiface Interface to probe
00081  *
00082  * @return Number of ports on the interface. Zero to disable.
00083  */
00084 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_probe(int xiface);
00085 
00086 /**
00087  * @INTERNAL
00088  * Bringup and enable a SGMII interface. After this call packet
00089  * I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD
00090  * enabled but PKO disabled. This is used by interfaces using the
00091  * bgx mac.
00092  *
00093  * @param xiface Interface to bring up
00094  *
00095  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00096  */
00097 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_enable(int xiface);
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * @INTERNAL
00101  * Return the link state of an IPD/PKO port as returned by
00102  * auto negotiation. The result of this function may not match
00103  * Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since
00104  * the last call to cvmx_helper_link_set(). This is used by
00105  * interfaces using the bgx mac.
00106  *
00107  * @param xipd_port IPD/PKO port to query
00108  *
00109  * @return Link state
00110  */
00111 extern cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_link_get(int xipd_port);
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * @INTERNAL
00115  * Configure an IPD/PKO port for the specified link state. This
00116  * function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level.
00117  * The passed link state must always match the link state returned
00118  * by cvmx_helper_link_get(). It is normally best to use
00119  * cvmx_helper_link_autoconf() instead. This is used by interfaces
00120  * using the bgx mac.
00121  *
00122  * @param xipd_port  IPD/PKO port to configure
00123  * @param link_info The new link state
00124  *
00125  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00126  */
00127 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_link_set(int xipd_port,
00128                         cvmx_helper_link_info_t link_info);
00129 
00130 /**
00131  * @INTERNAL
00132  * Configure a port for internal and/or external loopback. Internal loopback
00133  * causes packets sent by the port to be received by Octeon. External loopback
00134  * causes packets received from the wire to sent out again. This is used by
00135  * interfaces using the bgx mac.
00136  *
00137  * @param xipd_port IPD/PKO port to loopback.
00138  * @param enable_internal
00139  *                 Non zero if you want internal loopback
00140  * @param enable_external
00141  *                 Non zero if you want external loopback
00142  *
00143  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00144  */
00145 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_configure_loopback(int xipd_port,
00146                               int enable_internal,
00147                               int enable_external);
00148 
00149 /**
00150  * @INTERNAL
00151  * Bringup and enable a XAUI interface. After this call packet
00152  * I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD
00153  * enabled but PKO disabled. This is used by interfaces using the
00154  * bgx mac.
00155  *
00156  * @param xiface Interface to bring up
00157  *
00158  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00159  */
00160 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_xaui_enable(int xiface);
00161

00163 extern CVMX_SHARED int(*cvmx_helper_bgx_override_fec)(int xiface, int index);

00166  * @INTERNAL

00168  * auto negotiation. The result of this function may not match
00169  * Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since
00170  * the last call to cvmx_helper_link_set(). This is used by
00171  * interfaces using the bgx mac.
00172  *
00173  * @param xipd_port IPD/PKO port to query
00174  *
00175  * @return Link state
00176  */
00177 extern cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_bgx_xaui_link_get(int xipd_port);
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * @INTERNAL
00181  * Configure an IPD/PKO port for the specified link state. This
00182  * function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level.
00183  * The passed link state must always match the link state returned
00184  * by cvmx_helper_link_get(). It is normally best to use
00185  * cvmx_helper_link_autoconf() instead. This is used by interfaces
00186  * using the bgx mac.
00187  *
00188  * @param xipd_port  IPD/PKO port to configure
00189  * @param link_info The new link state
00190  *
00191  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00192  */
00193 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_xaui_link_set(int xipd_port,
00194                        cvmx_helper_link_info_t link_info);

00196 /**
00197  * @INTERNAL
00198  * Configure a port for internal and/or external loopback. Internal loopback
00199  * causes packets sent by the port to be received by Octeon. External loopback
00200  * causes packets received from the wire to sent out again. This is used by
00201  * interfaces using the bgx mac.
00202  *
00203  * @param xipd_port IPD/PKO port to loopback.
00204  * @param enable_internal
00205  *                 Non zero if you want internal loopback
00206  * @param enable_external
00207  *                 Non zero if you want external loopback
00208  *
00209  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00210  */
00211 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_xaui_configure_loopback(int xipd_port,
00212                              int enable_internal,
00213                              int enable_external);

00222                              int enable_internal,
00223                              int enable_external);

00225 extern cvmx_helper_interface_mode_t cvmx_helper_bgx_get_mode(int xiface, int index);
00226 
00227 /**
00228  * @INTERNAL
00229  * Configure Priority-Based Flow Control (a.k.a. PFC/CBFC)
00230  * on a specific BGX interface/port.
00231  */
00232 extern void __cvmx_helper_bgx_xaui_config_pfc(unsigned node,
00233         unsigned interface, unsigned port, bool pfc_enable);
00234 /**
00235  * This function control how the hardware handles incoming PAUSE
00236  * packets. The most common modes of operation:
00237  * ctl_bck = 1, ctl_drp = 1: hardware handles everything
00238  * ctl_bck = 0, ctl_drp = 0: software sees all PAUSE frames
00239  * ctl_bck = 0, ctl_drp = 1: all PAUSE frames are completely ignored
00240  * @param node      node number.
00241  * @param interface interface number
00242  * @param port      port number
00243  * @param ctl_bck   1: Forward PAUSE information to TX block
00244  * @param ctl_drp   1: Drop control PAUSE frames.
00245  */
00246 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_rx_pause_ctl(unsigned node, unsigned interface,
00247                   unsigned port, unsigned ctl_bck, unsigned ctl_drp);
00248 
00249 /**
00250  * This function configures the receive action taken for multicast, broadcast
00251  * and dmac filter match packets.
00252  * @param node      node number.
00253  * @param interface interface number
00254  * @param port      port number
00255  * @param cam_accept    0: reject packets on dmac filter match
00256  *                      1: accept packet on dmac filter match
00257  * @param mcast_mode    0x0 = Force reject all multicast packets
00258  *                      0x1 = Force accept all multicast packets
00259  *                      0x2 = Use the address filter CAM
00260  * @param bcast_accept  0 = Reject all broadcast packets
00261  *                      1 = Accept all broadcast packets
00262  */
00263 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_rx_adr_ctl(unsigned node, unsigned interface, unsigned port,
00264                                 unsigned cam_accept, unsigned mcast_mode, unsigned bcast_accept);
00265 
00266 /**
00267  * Function to control the generation of FCS, padding by the BGX
00268  *
00269  */
00270 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_tx_options(unsigned node,
00271     unsigned interface, unsigned index,
00272     bool fcs_enable, bool pad_enable);
00273 
00274 /**
00275  * Set mac for the ipd_port
00276  *
00277  * @param xipd_port ipd_port to set the mac
00278  * @param bcst      If set, accept all broadcast packets
00279  * @param mcst      Multicast mode
00280  *          0 = Force reject all multicast packets
00281  *          1 = Force accept all multicast packets
00282  *          2 = use the address filter CAM.
00283  * @param mac       mac address for the ipd_port
00284  */
00285 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_set_mac(int xipd_port, int bcst, int mcst, uint64_t mac);

00288 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_port_init(int xipd_port, int phy_pres);
00289 extern void cvmx_helper_bgx_set_jabber(int xiface, unsigned index, unsigned size);
00290 extern int cvmx_helper_bgx_shutdown_port(int xiface, int index);
00291 extern int cvmx_bgx_set_backpressure_override(int xiface, unsigned port_mask);
00292 extern int __cvmx_helper_bgx_fifo_size(int xiface, unsigned lmac);
00293 
00294 /**
00295  * Returns if an interface is RGMII or not
00296  *
00297  * @param xiface    xinterface to check
00298  * @param index     port index (must be 0 for rgmii)
00299  *
00300  * @return  true if RGMII, false otherwise
00301  */
00302 static inline bool cvmx_helper_bgx_is_rgmii(int xiface, int index)
00303 {
00304     union cvmx_bgxx_cmrx_config cmr_config;
00305 
00306     if (!OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) || index != 0)
00307         return false;
00308     cmr_config.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_BGXX_CMRX_CONFIG(index, xiface));
00309     return cmr_config.s.lmac_type == 5;
00310 }
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * Enables or disables autonegotiation for an interface.
00314  *
00315  * @param   xiface  interface to set autonegotiation
00316  * @param   index   port index
00317  * @param   enable  true to enable autonegotiation, false to disable it
00318  *
00319  * @return  0 for success, -1 on error.
00320  */
00321 int cvmx_helper_set_autonegotiation(int xiface, int index, bool enable);
00322 
00323 /**
00324  * Enables or disables forward error correction
00325  *
00326  * @param   xiface  interface
00327  * @param   index   port index
00328  * @param   enable  set to true to enable FEC, false to disable
00329  *
00330  * @return  0 for success, -1 on error
00331  *
00332  * @NOTE:   If autonegotiation is enabled then autonegotiation will be
00333  *      restarted for negotiating FEC.
00334  */
00335 int cvmx_helper_set_fec(int xiface, int index, bool enable);

00353 int cvmx_dump_bgx_status_node(unsigned node, unsigned bgx);
